    • Method Detail

      • exportWallet

        public static CompletableFuture<Integer> exportWallet(String exportPath,
                                                      String encryptionKey)
                                               throws VcxException

        Exports opened wallet.


        Allow users to export their wallets so the can do the backup or move their secret data to different agency or different device.
        - Export file will be encrypted with export key.
        - Export should contain the whole wallet data (including secrets).
        - Export should be done in a streaming way so big wallets may be exported on machines with conservative memory.
        Parameters:
        exportPath - Path to export wallet to User's File System.
        encryptionKey - String representing the User's Key for securing (encrypting) the exported Wallet. 
         Example:
      WalletApi.exportWallet("export/wallet_name", "mysecretkey").get();
        Returns:
        success indicates that the wallet was successfully exported.
        Throws:
        VcxException
        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        Wallet Export/Import Design

      • importWallet

        public static CompletableFuture<Integer> importWallet(String config)
                                               throws VcxException

        Imports wallet from file with given key.


        Creates a new secure wallet and then imports its content
        according to fields provided in import_config
        Cannot be used if wallet is already opened (Especially if vcx_init has already been used).
        Must include: '{"wallet_name":"","wallet_key":"","exported_wallet_path":"","backup_key":""}'
        Parameters:
        config - Can be same config that is passed to vcx_init.. 
         Example:
      WalletApi.importWallet({"wallet_name":"","wallet_key":"","exported_wallet_path":"","backup_key":"","key_derivation":""}).get();}
        Returns:
        success indicates that the wallet was successfully imported.
        Throws:
        VcxException
        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        Wallet Export/Import Design

      • signWithAddress

        public static CompletableFuture<byte[]> signWithAddress(String address,
                                                        byte[] message)
                                                 throws VcxException
        Signs a message with a payment address.
        Parameters:
        address: - Payment address of message signer.
        message - The message to be signed
        Returns:
        A future that resolves to a signature string.
        Throws:
        VcxException - Thrown if an error occurs when calling the underlying SDK.

      • verifyWithAddress

        public static CompletableFuture<Boolean> verifyWithAddress(String address,
                                                           byte[] message,
                                                           byte[] signature)
                                                    throws VcxException
        Verify a signature with a payment address.
        Parameters:
        address - Payment address of the message signer
        message - Message that has been signed
        signature - A signature to be verified
        Returns:
        A future that resolves to true if signature is valid, otherwise false.
        Throws:
        VcxException - Thrown if an error occurs when calling the underlying SDK.

      • addRecordWallet

        public static CompletableFuture<Integer> addRecordWallet(String recordType,
                                                         String recordId,
                                                         String recordValue,
                                                         String tagsJson)
                                                  throws VcxException
        Adds a record to the wallet
        Assumes there is an open wallet.
        Parameters:
        recordType - type of record. (e.g. 'data', 'string', 'foobar', 'image')
        recordId - the id ("key") of the record.
        recordValue - value of the record with the associated id.
        tagsJson - the record tags used for search and storing meta information as json. 
               {
       "tagName1": , // string tag (will be stored encrypted)
       "tagName2": , // int tag (will be stored encrypted)
       "~tagName3": , // string tag (will be stored un-encrypted)
       "~tagName4": , // int tag (will be stored un-encrypted)
       }
 The tags_json must be valid json, and if no tags are to be associated with the
 record, then the empty '{}' json must be passed.
        Returns:
        Throws:
        VcxException - Thrown if an error occurs when calling the underlying SDK. 
         Example:
     String newPwDid = ConnectionApi.connectionGetPwDid(connectionHandle).get();
     serializedConnection = ConnectionApi.connectionSerialize(connectionHandle).get();
     WalletApi.addRecordWallet("connection", newPwDid, serializedConnection, "").get();

        public static CompletableFuture<Integer> deleteRecordWallet(String recordType,
                                                            String recordId)
                                                     throws VcxException
        Deletes an existing record Assumes there is an open wallet and that a type and id pair already exists.
        Parameters:
        recordType - type of record. (e.g. 'data', 'string', 'foobar', 'image')
        recordId - the id ("key") of the record.
        Returns:
        Completable future
        Throws:
        VcxException - Thrown if an error occurs when calling the underlying SDK.

      • updateRecordWallet

        public static CompletableFuture<Integer> updateRecordWallet(String recordType,
                                                            String recordId,
                                                            String recordValue)
                                                     throws VcxException
        Updates the value of a record already in the wallet.
        Assumes there is an open wallet and that a type and id pair already exists.
        Parameters:
        recordType - type of record. (e.g. 'data', 'string', 'foobar', 'image')
        recordId - the id ("key") of the record.
        recordValue - New value of the record with the associated id.
        Returns:
        Completable future
        Throws:
        VcxException - Thrown if an error occurs when calling the underlying SDK.

      • addRecordTagsWallet

        public static CompletableFuture<Integer> addRecordTagsWallet(String recordType,
                                                             String recordId,
                                                             String tagsJson)
                                                      throws VcxException
        Add tags to a record already stored in the storage wallet.
        Parameters:
        recordType - Allows to separate different record types collections
        recordId - The id of record
        tagsJson - The record tags used for search and storing meta information as json: 
        
                  {
                      "tagName1": "str", // string tag (will be stored encrypted)
                      "~tagName2": "str", // string tag (will be stored un-encrypted)
                  }
        Returns:
        A future that resolves no value.
        Throws:
        VcxException - Thrown if an error occurs when calling the underlying SDK.

      • updateRecordTagsWallet

        public static CompletableFuture<Integer> updateRecordTagsWallet(String recordType,
                                                                String recordId,
                                                                String tagsJson)
                                                         throws VcxException
        Update tags on a record, removing any previous value.
        Parameters:
        recordType - Allows to separate different record types collections
        recordId - The id of record
        tagsJson - The record tags used for search and storing meta information as json: 
        
                  {
                      "tagName1": "str", // string tag (will be stored encrypted)
                      "~tagName2": "str", // string tag (will be stored un-encrypted)
                  }
        Returns:
        A future that resolves no value.
        Throws:
        VcxException - Thrown if an error occurs when calling the underlying SDK.

      • deleteRecordTagsWallet

        public static CompletableFuture<Integer> deleteRecordTagsWallet(String recordType,
                                                                String recordId,
                                                                String tagNamesJson)
                                                         throws VcxException
        Delete tags associated with a record
        Parameters:
        recordType - Allows to separate different record types collections
        recordId - The id of record
        tagNamesJson - The list of tag names to remove from the record as json array: 
        
                     ["tagName1", "tagName2", ...]
        Returns:
        A future that resolves no value.
        Throws:
        VcxException - Thrown if an error occurs when calling the underlying SDK.

      • openSearchWallet

        public static CompletableFuture<Integer> openSearchWallet(String recordType,
                                                          String queryJson,
                                                          String optionsJson)
                                                   throws VcxException
        Open a search handle within the storage wallet.
        Parameters:
        recordType - Allows to separate different record types collections
        queryJson - MongoDB style query to wallet record tags: 
        
                    {
                      "tagName": "tagValue",
                      $or: {
                          "tagName2": { $regex: 'pattern' },
                          "tagName3": { $gte: '123' },
                      }
                    }
        optionsJson - string 
        
                    {
                      retrieveRecords: (optional, true by default) If false only "counts" will be calculated,
                      retrieveTotalCount: (optional, false by default) Calculate total count,
                      retrieveType: (optional, false by default) Retrieve record type,
                      retrieveValue: (optional, true by default) Retrieve record value,
                      retrieveTags: (optional, false by default) Retrieve record tags,
                    }
        Returns:
        A future that resolves to WalletSearch instance.
        Throws:
        VcxException - Thrown if an error occurs when calling the underlying SDK.

      • searchNextRecordsWallet

        public static CompletableFuture<String> searchNextRecordsWallet(int searchHandle,
                                                                int count)
                                                         throws VcxException
        Search for next n record from an open search handle
        Parameters:
        searchHandle - The wallet search handle.
        count - Count of records to fetch
        Returns:
        A future resolving to the wallet records json: 
        
 {
      totalCount: int, // present only if retrieveTotalCount set to true
      records: [{ // present only if retrieveRecords set to true
          id: "Some id",
          type: "Some type", // present only if retrieveType set to true
          value: "Some value", // present only if retrieveValue set to true
          tags: "Some tags json", // present only if retrieveTags set to true
      }],
 }
        Throws:
        VcxException - Thrown if an error occurs when calling the underlying SDK.

      • closeSearchWallet

        public static CompletableFuture<Integer> closeSearchWallet(int searchHandle)
                                                    throws VcxException
        Close a search
        Parameters:
        searchHandle - The wallet search handle.
        Returns:
        A future resolving to no value.
        Throws:
        VcxException - Thrown if an error occurs when calling the underlying SDK.
